configuration_id.description: A unique ID that identifies what configuration was run. It links to a metadata document that defines all the settings that were used system-wide to generate this trajectory fragment

local_fragment_id.description: Integer unique to each tracked vehicle per compute_node_ID and configuration_ID, generated by the tracker

compute_node_id.description: The generating trackerâ€™s unique compute node id. Roughly, it maps to what hardware was used to generate the trajectory fragment

timestamp.description: Corrected timestamp. This timestamp may be corrected to reduce timestamp errors.

raw_timestamp.description: Raw timestamps from video frames as reported by the camera. This may contain bias or other errors.

first_timestamp.description: Min timestamp from all timestamps in the trajectory fragment

last_timestamp.description: Max timestamp from all timestamps in the trajectory fragment

road_segment_ids.description: Unique road segment ID. This differentiates the mainline from entrance ramps and exit ramps, which get distinct road segment IDs.

x_position.description: Array of back-center x position along the road segment in feet. The  position x=0 occurs at the start of the road segment.

y_position.description: array of back-center y position across the road segment in feet. y=0 is located at the left yellow line, i.e., the left-most edge of the left-most lane of travel in each direction.

starting_x.description: The first x_position in the fragment.

ending_x.description: The last x_position in the fragment.

flags.description: Array of any string flags describing the data.
